string.text: If you have Coverdrave's Reworked RF Receiver addon installed, checking this option will make NERFS use that addon's MCM settings for equip state, beeps, and frequency changes. All other RRFR improvements are included in NERFS.\n Please note that if you use Devices of Anomaly Redone, it will override the setting for whether the RF Receiver must be equipped to work.

Noisy, but contains useful debugging information. If you are reporting an issue, please FIRST:

 1. Enable this setting
 2. Exit the game completely
 3. Reload the game and reproduce the issue - without other addons, if possible
 4. Exit the game

 Then zip up the game log from [anomaly_folder]/appdata/logs and put it somewhere online

The RF Receiver can display a maximum of three digits, but is clamped to VHF ranges (30-300 Mhz). However, some vanilla signal sources are outside of that range. This setting expands both the frequency range of the receiver, and the range that the game uses when giving out tasks.

New Extensible RF Sources improves the RF Receiver in multiple ways:
 • Expands the frequency range from 300 to 999 (configurable below)
 • Adds interesting new sources of RF noise
 • Moves all RF sources into an extensible LTX-based framework designed to be moddable and conflict-free
 • Adds lootable notes (with accompanying encyclopedia articles) that can be randomly found on dead stalkers, allowing players to learn about useful frequencies through gameplay
 • Adds an optional HUD indicator of signal strength, for accessibility or preference
 • Includes support for Reworked RF Receiver and TB's RF Tasks
For more information, see the Moddb page:\nhttps://www.moddb.com/mods/stalker-anomaly/addons/new-extensible-rf-sources

The accessibility widget provides a visual HUD indicator for RF signal strength, which will only appear when the RF Receiver device is active. It is intended for deaf and hearing-impaired persons, but can be used by anyone who finds the the audio cues hard to identify. Indicator position and colors can be customized for preference or color-blindness.

The indicator will display this color when signal strength is low.
Default (grey): 255,50,50,50

The indicator will display this color when signal strength is high.
Default (green): 255,0,250,0

The indicator will display this color during emissions.
Default (red): 128,200,0,0
XY position of the upper left corner of the widget:
0,0 is the upper left corner, 1024,768 is the lower right. The game converts this to whatever your resolution is. The default (lower center) is 491,670.
Use mouse wheel to change frequency

If enabled, the mouse wheel can be scrolled up and down to change frequency. Just as in vanilla, holding Shift or Alt will change the increment to 10 or 50, respectively. These go by much more quickly when scrolling!\n This feature requires modded binaries version 20230701 or newer. It is not currently supported by GAMMA.
You can define up to nine preset frequencies, and assign a different hotkey to each.
If mousewheel support is enabled, you can also hold Ctrl while scrolling in order to cycle through the presets below.
ERROR: item_radio.script is wrong, NERFS is not installed properly!\n

New Extensible RF Sources found the wrong copy of item_radio.script installed. This is almost certainly caused by loading another addon after NERFS which modifies this file.


You MUST install NERFS after any other addon that modifies item_radio.script. If you are using Reworked RF Receiver, RF Tasks, Remote Controlled Explosives, or Bizarre Interference, NERFS has compatibility options that will allow these addons to work normally.


If you are using Devices of Anomaly Redone, load it before NERFS--you should overwrite the stripped-down, embedded version of NERFS that is included with it.

 %c[pda_white]2. Enable the %c[pda_yellow]Debug logging%c[pda_white] option

I don't get notified about Moddb comments, so you will generally get the quickest response on the GAMMA Discord, in the discussion channel for Anomalous RF Signals / New Extensible RF Sources. Unsolicited DMs will be ignored.
